units.title: Fluorescent reporter knock‑in construction
units.text: For the construction of a ﬂuorescent reporter, an LGR5-P2A-mNeonGreen knock-in reporter was introduced into the last exon of LGR5 via electroporation, using previously published sgRNA (Sup-
units.rationale: Describes the genome editing step to create a reporter organoid line.

units.title: Crypt isolation and embedding
units.text: Tissues were transferred into Dulbecco’s phosphate-buffered saline (DPBS) and placed on ice until processing. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48‑well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidiﬁcation, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 µM Y‑27632 (TargetMol).
units.rationale: Provides the step‑by‑step procedure for isolating intestinal crypts and initiating organoid culture.

units.title: Organoid culture medium composition
units.text: Basal medium contained Advanced DMEM/F12 (Gibco) supplemented with B‑27 (Gibco), 10 mM HEPES (Corning), 2 mM GlutaMAX (Gibco), Penicillin‑Streptomycin (Gibco), and 1 mM N‑Acetyl‑L‑cysteine (Sigma). For IL‑hSIO culture, 50% Wnt3A conditioned medium, 10% R‑spondin1 conditioned medium, 50 ng/mL EGF (Peprotech), 2 µM DMH1, 0.5 µM A83‑01, 3 µM CHIR, 20 nM TSA, 100 µg/mL pVc (Sigma) and 0.5 µM CP673451 (TargetMol) were added to the basal medium.
units.rationale: Specifies the exact formulation of the growth medium used for organoid expansion.

units.title: EdU proliferation assay
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour. Organoids were then collected, fixed, permeabilized, and EdU detection was performed according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
units.rationale: Outlines the labeling and detection of proliferating cells within organoids.

units.title: Immunofluorescence staining
units.text: Immunofluorescence was performed as previously described22. Briefly, organoids were released from BME with DPBS, fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde (Sangon Biotech) for 30 minutes at room temperature, and permeabilized in DPBS containing 0.5% Triton X‑100. Samples were blocked and incubated in blocking buffer (0.1% BSA, 0.5% Tween 20 in DPBS) containing primary antibodies at 4 °C overnight. Samples were washed and incubated with secondary antibodies (1:1000, Invitrogen) for 1 hour at room temperature, counterstained with DAPI, and images were taken.
units.rationale: Details the complete immunostaining workflow for visualizing cell‑type markers.

units.title: Single‑cell RNA‑seq library preparation
units.text: Organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) at 37 °C for 10 minutes. The resulting single‑cell suspension was passed through a 40 µm cell strainer (Falcon) to remove any remaining cell aggregates. A cell counter (Countstar) was used for quality control. Single‑cell RNA sequencing libraries were prepared using the 10x Genomics Chromium 3’ Gene Expression solution v3.1 following the manufacturer’s protocol and sequenced on a NovaSeq6000 (Illumina).
units.rationale: Provides the protocol for generating single‑cell transcriptomic data from organoids.

units.title: Colony‑forming efficiency assay
units.text: To assess colony‑forming efficiency, organoids were dissociated into single cells and replated at a density of 8000 cells/well BME in 48‑well plates. After 7 days, colonies were fixed, stained with DAPI, and counted manually. Colony‑forming efficiency = number of colonies/number of plated cells × 100%.
units.rationale: Describes how to quantify the ability of single cells to generate new organoid colonies.

units.title: Directed differentiation to Paneth cells
units.text: Organoids were induced to differentiate by directly changing the culture media to differentiation media. Paneth cells: EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF‑I (100 ng/mL), FGF‑2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 µM), R‑spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83‑01 (0.5 µM), CHIR (4 µM), DAPT (10 µM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR‑1 (2 µM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Specifies the small‑molecule cocktail and timing used to drive Paneth cell differentiation.

units.title: Flow cytometry staining and analysis
units.text: Cells were stained with Hoechst (Beyotime) to identify live cells before FACS analysis. FACS was performed on a BD FACSVerse (BD Biosciences), and data were analyzed in FlowJo (V10).
units.rationale: Outlines the live‑cell staining and flow‑cytometric assessment of organoid‑derived cells.

units.title: RT‑qPCR gene expression analysis
units.text: Total RNA was isolated using Trizol reagent (TransGen Biotech) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Up to 1 µg of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis using the NovoScriptPlus Reverse Transcriptase kit (NovoProtein). qPCR was performed using the ChamQ Universal SYBR qPCR Master Mix (Vazyme) on a CFX384 Real‑Time System (BioRad). Relative gene expression levels were calculated using the ΔΔCt method.
units.rationale: Provides the workflow for quantifying transcript levels in organoid samples.
